titlestmt.titleproper: Collection Guide to the J. Kirk Felsman Fellowship Collection, 2014 RL.11045
titlestmt.author: Katrina Martin

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-12-14 13:54:51 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The J. Kirk Felsman Fellowship Collection contains 97 digital photographic prints from the series "Waves of Childhood: Photographs taken by Syrian Girls in Za'atari Refugee Camp" facilitated by 2014 Felsman Fellow Laura Doggett. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Administered by the J. Kirk Felsman Program for Children in Adversity, J. Kirk Felsman Fellowships provide post-masters professional opportunities in social entrepreneurship to graduates of the Duke Master of Public Policy program and the Duke Master of Fine Arts in Experimental and Documentary Arts programs.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The J. Kirk Felsman Fellowship Collection contains 97 digital photographic prints from the series "Waves of Childhood: Photographs taken by Syrian Girls in Za'atari Refugee Camp" facilitated by 2014 Felsman Fellow Laura Doggett. The world's second largest refugee camp, Za'atari Refugee Camp in Jordan is home to nearly 50,000 Syrian refugee children. For three months, Laura Doggett mentored a group of Syrian girls ages 14-18 in a media workshop to gain artistic and technical training in photography and video, with encouragement to reflect on their own stories and those of their community. The color digital photographs are printed on Premium Luster 11"x17" photo paper.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Kirk Felsman Fellowship Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The J. Kirk Felsman Fellowship Collection was acquired by the Archive of Documentary Arts as a gift in 2015.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by: Katrina Martin, August 2015. Accessions described in this finding aid: 2015-0024

controlaccess.geogname: J. Kirk Felsman Program on Children in Adversity

did.unittitle: Waves of Childhood: Photographs taken by Syrian Girls at Za'atari Refugee Camp, 2014

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Each print in the Waves of Childhood series is "Untitled" and was taken by Syrian girls aged 14-18 in the Za'atari Refugee Camp, Jordan in 2014. The names of the photographers have been redacted.
